Authors:
Michael A. Castellano, Todd F. Elliott, Camille Truong,
Olivier Sene, Bryn T. M. Dentinger, Terry Henkel
Title:
Kombocles bakaiana gen. sp. nov. (Boletaceae), a new
sequestrate fungus from Cameroon
Keywords:
ectomycorrhizal fungi, false truffle, Uapaca,
Guineo-Congolian rainforest, sequestrate fungi
Abstract:
Kombocles bakaiana gen. sp. nov. is described as new to
science. This sequestrate, hypogeous fungus was collected in Cameroon in
a lowland Guineo-Congolian mixed tropical rainforest in close proximity
to ectomycorrhizal (ECM) trees of the genus Uapaca (Phyllanthaceae).
Molecular data place this fungus in Boletaceae (Boletales,
Agaricomycetes, Basidiomycota) and inform its relationship to other
known epigeous and sequestrate taxa within that family. Macro- and
micromorphological characters, habitat, and DNA sequence data are
provided. Unique morphological features and a molecular phylogenetic
analysis of 304 sequences across the Boletales justify the recognition
of the new genus. Kombocles bakaiana is the fourth sequestrate
Boletaceae described from the greater African tropics, and the first to
be described from Cameroon.
